Description: Fragment of plain weave, linen textile; part of one end of undyed, linen; one side mainly covered by closely spaced rows of looped pile (loops c.5cm long); beyond looped area are three triple self-bands and an open weave band (c.13 cm deep) ending in a 1.5cm strip of woven cloth, this strip turned back on itself and originally sewn (maybe cut from a larger piece in antique or modern times), other edges torn; warp-undyed linen (S/c.21), weft-undyed linen (S/c.13-16); loops in paired threads; irregular pattern to the loops, c.3-6 ends between each loop and c.16 picks between each row of pile
Curator's comments: Unreg. 504; found with un-numbered textiles in cupboard P
